bwwExcerpt: While Crystal and the cast are droll and endearing, "Mr. Saturday Night" (directed by John Rando with an especially small cast for an old-fashioned-style musical comedy) is pretty dull, slow, and schmaltzy. The gentle score, much of which was custom-built for a leading man with a limited vocal range, lacks the flavor and bite of Brown and Green's best work. showScoreExcerpt:
"Did the world really need a weak musical adaptation of Billy Crystal’s little-remembered 1992 film comedy 'Mr. Saturday Night' – even if it meant Crystal reprising the role he played in the film and, for better or worse, making his singing debut?"
